definition: of no value or worth, an average of n numbers computed by adding some function of the numbers and dividing by some function of n, have in mind as a purpose
details:
adjective
- of no value or worth
= synonyms: bastardly
- used of sums of money, so small in amount as to deserve contempt
= example: used of sums of money, so small in amount as to deserve contempt
= synonyms: beggarly
- (used of persons or behavior) characterized by or indicative of lack of generosity
= example: (used of persons or behavior) characterized by or indicative of lack of generosity
= synonyms: tight, mingy, miserly
- characterized by malice
= synonyms: hateful
- having or showing an ignoble lack of honor or morality
= synonyms: base, meanspirited
- marked by poverty befitting a beggar
= synonyms: beggarly
- excellent
= example: excellent
= synonyms: top-flight, top-hole, topping
- approximating the statistical norm or average or expected value
= synonyms: average
noun
- an average of n numbers computed by adding some function of the numbers and dividing by some function of n
= synonyms: mean value
verb
- have in mind as a purpose
= example: have in mind as a purpose
= synonyms: think, intend
- destine or designate for a certain purpose
= example: destine or designate for a certain purpose
- intend to refer to
= synonyms: think of, have in mind
- denote or connote
= example: denote or connote
= synonyms: stand for, intend, signify
- mean or intend to express or convey
= example: mean or intend to express or convey
= synonyms: intend
- have as a logical consequence
= example: have as a logical consequence
= synonyms: entail
- have a specified degree of importance
= example: have a specified degree of importance
